meanings.definition: Remove air or gas from (a liquid)
meanings.sent1: The machine deaerates the juice before packaging.
meanings.sent2: She deaerates the paint to ensure a smooth finish.
meanings.sent3: The chef deaerates the batter to make the fluffiest pancakes.
meanings.sent4: His laughter deaerates the tension in the room.
meanings.sent5: The vacuum cleaner deaerates the carpet, making it look fresh and clean.

meanings.definition: To make free of air or gas
meanings.sent1: The mechanic deaerates the brake lines for better performance.
meanings.sent2: After shaking the soda can, she deaerates it by opening it slowly.
meanings.sent3: The magician deaerates the balloon, making it disappear into thin air.
meanings.sent4: Her smile deaerates the gloominess of the rainy day.
meanings.sent5: The scuba diver deaerates the tank before going underwater to ensure safety.

meanings.definition: To remove air or gas from a substance
meanings.sent1: The scientist deaerates the solution to prevent bubbles.
meanings.sent2: Before sealing the package, she deaerates it to avoid expansion during shipping.
meanings.sent3: The astronaut deaerates the suit before stepping out into space.
meanings.sent4: His calming presence deaerates her anxiety.
meanings.sent5: The baker deaerates the dough to create the perfect texture for the bread.
